uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools
Class MetaShader

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.MetaShader
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener, Shader, ShaderChangedListener
public class MetaShader
extends java.lang.Object
implements Shader, ShaderChangedListener, java.awt.event.ItemListener

This is an experimental wrapper used to hold shaders.
By using this it should be possible to switch between different shading stratergies in a simple manner.

setMissingValueCode

public void setMissingValueCode(double c)
Description copied from interface: Shader
Set the code that represents a missing value. Many data sets have missing values in them represented by a code, my using this method you can tell the shader what that value is. e.g. Arc/Info often uses -9999
Specified by:
setMissingValueCode in interface Shader
Following copied from interface: uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.Shader
Parameters:
code - The double used to represent a missing value.
See Also:
Shader.setMissingValueColor(java.awt.Color)

getMissingValueCode

public double getMissingValueCode()
Description copied from interface: Shader
Gets the current code used to represent a missing value. Many data sets have missing values in them represented by a code, my using this method you can ask the shader what value it is currently using.

shaderChanged

public void shaderChanged(ShaderChangedEvent sce)
Called by the shader which the meta shader is currently using.
The call simply passes the notification up to users of the MetaShader.
